page.title: 09Attitudes to Life in Sale
page.content: A questionnaire answered mainly by 2nd years but also covering other age groups showed a majority thinking that Sale is a goog place to live because it has: good public transport, is near motorways, easy access to Manchester, relatively unspoilt residential area, clean air. But concern shown over: amount of crime(burglary & vandalism), high population density, heavy traffic & parking problems, overspill estate. Half of those over 30 thought that Sale is worse now than 10-20 years ago (more women than men) because of: more noise, litter, vandalism, drug abuse, poorer shopping facilities, fewer cinemas. Most approved of the new facilities (Leisure Centre, pedestrian area, Water Park)but shopping precinct was criticised as: lacking essential shops, compares badly with Altrincham and Stretford, attracting youths.
